Package nl.codevs.strinput.system

package nl.codevs.strinput.system
StrInput system implementation.
  • StrCenter the beating heart of any command system.
    Implement this and call StrCenter.onCommand( java.util.List, nl.codevs.strinput.system.StrUser) with command details.
  • StrUser Make an implementation for your platform of this class.
    All senders must implement this, so the system can interact.
    You can add extra fields, see the class' documentation.
  • StrCategory All command categories (with methods as commands), implement this interface.
  • StrSettings Contain the default and non-text-configurable settings.
  • StrInput and Param are annotations used to indicate commands / categories and command parameters respectively. All commands, categories and parameters must be annotated by these.
  • Env contains environment variables such as the StrCenter and StrUser currently active on the thread.
  • Interface Summary
    Interface
    Description
    StrCategory
    Command and/or command category interface.
    StrUser
    Instance of a user (the sender/receiver, end-user client).
  • Class Summary

    Description
    Env
    Environment variables available on a per-thread basis.

    Context handling for command centers (command center handling).

    Context handling (user handling).
    k

    Input center.
    StrCenter.ContextHandling
    Str context handling.
    StrCenter.ParameterHandling
    Str parameter handling.
    StrCenter.Roots
    Command roots mapping.
    Functions just as a normal ConcurrentHashMap but setup is built-in.
    StrSettings
    StrInput settings.

    Enum Class
    Description

  • Exception Summary
    Exception
    Description
    StrCenter.ContextHandling.StrNoContextHandlerException
    Exception thrown when no context handlers could be found.
    StrCenter.ParameterHandling.StrNoParameterHandlerException
    Exception thrown when no parameter handler could be found.
  • Annotation Interfaces Summary
    Annotation Interface
    Description
    Param
    Command parameters' annotation.
    StrInput
    Annotation for commands (methods) and categories (classes).
    Note that while all settings are optional, StrInput.name() should be specified on a category.
